page.title: 04Farming in the Brereton Area
page.content: The farms in Brereton are generally mixed farms with cattle,cereal and potato production and a few sheep.Most of them vary in size from approx,100 to 250 acres. The predominant enterprize is{dairying and without exception all the milk is produced from the dairy cow.The average herd size is about 100 cows. Beef cattle are reared on some farms to use the home-grown barley. {Potatoes}are a popular crop on about one third of the farms with farmers growing between 10 to 30 acres. Second earlies and maincrop potatoes are the most common with one farmer producing a quantity for crisps. {Sheep,}feature too,some are owned by the farmer either for lambing and fattening or are just bought in for finishing.Some are hill-sheep grazed in the area and returned in the Spring
